Introduction.content:
In the middle of Mbuyuni village stood a baobab tree older than anyone could remember.

Its trunk was so big that ten children holding hands could not reach around it.

Every evening, old women sat under its shade and told stories.

They always said the same thing:

â€œThis tree keeps every secret it hears. Never tell it something you donâ€™t want the whole world to know one day.â€

Nobody believed themâ€¦ until little Zuri did.

Chapter 1.content:
Zuri was eleven years old.

She had a secret that made her cry every night.

Her father left the village two years ago to look for work in the city. He promised to come back. He never did.

One afternoon, when nobody was watching, Zuri ran to the baobab tree.

She pressed her mouth to a hole in the trunk and whispered,

â€œDaddy, please come home. I miss you so much.â€

![Little girl whispering to tree](https://picsum.photos/seed/zuri-whisper-tree/800/600)

Chapter 2.content:
That night, every person in the village dreamed the same dream.

They heard Zuriâ€™s voice crying, â€œDaddy, please come home.â€

The next night, the same dream again.

By the third night, mothers woke up crying. Fathers could not sleep.

Everyone knew the tree had spoken.

![Village people waking up crying](https://picsum.photos/seed/village-cry-night/800/600)

Chapter 3.content:
The village chief called a big meeting under the baobab.

He said, â€œThe tree has told us a child is hurting. We must help.â€

Ten strong men took a bus to the city the next morning.

They looked everywhere: markets, bus stations, construction sites.

They carried a photo of Zuriâ€™s father.

![Men searching city with photo](https://picsum.photos/seed/men-search-city/800/600)

Chapter 4.content:
They found him living under a bridge.

He was thin and sick. He had lost his job and was too ashamed to come home.

When they showed him the photo of Zuri, he started crying.

â€œI thought they were better without me,â€ he said.

The men gave him new clothes, food, and a bus ticket home.

![Father crying under bridge](https://picsum.photos/seed/father-bridge-cry/800/600)

Chapter 5.content:
One month later, Zuri was playing near the baobab when she heard footsteps.

She looked upâ€¦ and saw her father walking towards her.

He opened his arms. Zuri ran faster than the wind.

They hugged and cried under the big tree.

![Father and daughter hugging under baobab](https://picsum.photos/seed/reunion-baobab/800/600)

The whole village came out clapping and singing.

Conclusion.content:
From that day, the baobab tree looked happier. Its leaves were greener than ever.

Old women still sit in its shade, but now they tell a new story:

â€œThe tree does not just keep secretsâ€¦ it fixes broken hearts.â€

And when the wind blows, sometimes you can still hear a little girlâ€™s voice whispering â€œThank youâ€ to the tree.

The end.
